alert.note: Alert for Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 13 at 8:19PM MST until November 14 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...QUICK BURST OF WINTER WEATHER TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... .A quick-hitting winter storm system will produce a burst of snow and wind with much colder temperatures tonight through Monday morning. Travel impacts are possible over parts of the area with areas of snow, strong winds, blowing snow, and reduced visibility. Wind chill values Monday morning will fall into the single digits. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Union County. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Noon MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of U.S. 64 from Clayton to Des Moines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
